official-title.#text:
To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to improve audit effectiveness and efficiency in
			 paying for durable medical equipment, prosthetics, orthotics, and supplies
			 (DMEPOS) under the Medicare program, and for other purposes.

quote.#text: DMEPOS payment outreach and education program

text.#text:
In order to reduce improper payments under part B for durable medical equipment, prosthetics,
			 orthotics, and supplies, each medicare administrative contractor that has
			 responsibility for payment under such part for durable medical equipment,
			 prosthetics, orthotics, and supplies furnished in an area (in this
			 subsection referred to as a
The activities under a DMEPOS payment outreach and education program shall include the following:
Emails and other electronic communications.
Webinars.
Telephone calls.
In-person training.
Other forms of communications and assistance determined appropriate by the

The information to be provided under a DMEPOS payment outreach and education program, with respect
			 to payment for DMEPOS under part B, shall include all of the following
			 information:

header.#text: Information to be provided through activities

text.#text:
A list of suppliers’ most frequent payment errors and most expensive payment errors over the last
			 quarter.
Specific instructions regarding how to correct or avoid such errors in the future.

for audits conducted by

The activities under a DMEPOS payment outreach and education program shall include error rate

be provided at least annually; and
focus on reducing improper Medicare payments for DMEPOS.
Such training shall—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: either in person or online.

text.#text:
A Medicare DMEPOS contractor with responsibility for payment for DMEPOS in an area shall ensure
			 that all DMEPOS suppliers, physicians and practitioners who prescribe
			 DMEPOS, and discharge planners and case managers who coordinate DMEPOS for
			 individuals in the area are invited to attend the training described in

A Medicare DMEPOS contractor shall give priority to activities under the DMEPOS payment outreach
			 and education program that will reduce improper Medicare payments based on
			 technical errors, medical necessity, and fraud for DMEPOS that—
have the highest rate of improper payment under part B;
have the greatest total dollar amount of such improper payments;
are due to clear misapplication or misinterpretation of policies under this title;
are clearly due to common and inadvertent clerical or administrative errors; or

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines could be prevented through
			 activities under the program.

			 a quarterly basis.

text.#text:
For purposes of determining under this title the reasonableness and medical necessity of prosthetic
			 devices and orthotics and prosthetics, documentation created by orthotists
			 and prosthetists relating to the need for such devices, orthotics, and
			 prosthetics shall be considered part of the medical record.

The amendments made by this subsection shall apply with respect to payments made for items and
			 services furnished on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
